name: Bosnia and Herzegovina
partner: Central European Institute of Asian Studies (CEIAS)
takeaway: The significant investment from the People's Republic of China, particularly in infrastructure projects in Republika Srpska, showcases the growing economic ties between China and Bosnia and Herzegovina. The focus on Republika Srpska highlights an evolving regional dynamic closer aligned with Chinese interests in Serbia.

The presence of Xinhua Chinese news agency raises questions about media influence and perception. Despite operating relatively under the radar, its dual function as a news agency and a perceived tool of Chinese government propaganda challenges its credibility and acceptance within the liberal views dominant in the region.

The establishment of a Department for Chinese Language and Culture at the University of East Sarajevo, along with annual training visits for civil servants organized by the PRC Ministry of Foreign Affairs, highlights a growing cultural and educational exchange between Bosnia and Herzegovina – RS (Republican Party) entities mainly – and China.

The strategic partnership between the Alliance of Independent Social Democrats (SNSD) and the Communist Party of China underlines a deeper political engagement beyond economic ties. Such partnerships indicate a broader geopolitical alignment and cooperation between certain political entities in Bosnia and Herzegovina (again, mainly in RS) and China, potentially influencing policy decisions and regional dynamics.

Bosnia and Herzegovina's involvement in international statements concerning human rights issues in China, despite protests from the Chinese Embassy, reflects the country's position within the broader context of international relations and adherence to human rights principles. This engagement showcases Bosnia and Herzegovina's state-level institutions' willingness to align with international norms and values, despite potential diplomatic pressures.
description-1: In 2023, Bosnia-and-Herzegovina had a GDP per capita of US$8,426 and a total population of 3.19 million people.
description-2: Bosnia-and-Herzegovina established full diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China in 1995. Bosnia-and-Herzegovina was ranked 81st in Reporters Without Borders‘ 2024 World Press Freedom Index, and rated Partly Free in Freedom House‘s 2024 Global Freedom Index, with a score of 51/100.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Media.note:
very few academic or other types of reliable sources available on the subject. One such was published 2 years ago, Foreign-Directed Media Content and Normative Localization of Government Narratives Abroad: An Analysis of Editorial Policies Of Chinese News Agency Xinhua in Bosnia And Herzegovina, by Duraković, Jasna and Hasić, Jasmin, URL:
https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Jasmin-Hasic/publication/368720627_Foreign-Directed_Media_Content_and_Normative_Localization_of_Government_Narratives_Abroad_An_Analysis_of_Editorial_Policies_Of_Chinese_News_Agency_Xinhua_in_Bosnia_And_Herzegovina/links/63f72f715749505945388677/Foreign-Directed-Media-Content-and-Normative-Localization-of-Government-Narratives-Abroad-An-Analysis-of-Editorial-Policies-Of-Chinese-News-Agency-Xinhua-in-Bosnia-And-Herzegovina.pdf
Media.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: Radio and Television of Bosnia-Herzegovina (BHRT) is a part of the Belt and Road News Alliance (BRNA).

Media.evidence: A prominent jorunalist Faruk Borić is regular visitor of the China, and also leads two online platrofms one of which is called Glas Kine, and secon one Centar za promociju i razvoj inicijative Pojas i put
Media.note: There are some local trainings organized in Sarajevo, focused on "how to report on China", organized by a local NGO, sponsored by Albany Global media center. https://media.ba/bs/event/trening-za-novinareke-i-istrazivaceice-nr-kina-u-bih-gdje-je-prisutna-i-kako-izvjestavati-o

Media.evidence: China's national television broadcast a program with the logo of the Federal Television. Damira Ibranović, a journalist of a public broadcasting service of FBiH on a study visit to China, has taken part in this. Together with a colleague from China National Television, she summarized the National People's Congress of China - the most important event of the year for that country.

Media.evidence: Xinhua office in Bosnia and Herzegovina. Xinhua’s role in the news production system in B&H, though kept relatively under the radar of the general public, is being additionally weakened by its ‘status’ and by being perceived through its dual function: as a propagandist tool of the Chinese government and as a news agency whose interest and credibility are not fully in line with socially accepted and otherwise dominant liberal views.
Media.note: BiH is notably the first country in the Balkans to host a dedicated outlet to China’s perspective and its BRI (Glas Kine – The Voice of China issued by the Sarajevo-based Bosnia-China Friendship Association), but these seem to have limited audience.
Media.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: Xinhua also has a cooperation agreement with the Patria News Agency, which is closely aligned with the Party of Democratic Action. Local Xinhua journalists are quite active beyond their immediate professional purview – giving lectures at universities, for instance.

Media.evidence: Yes, but only if Chinese-Serb relations are taken within a larger context (encompassiing Serbia and Serbs living outside of Serbia); and if and when the local Serb population or representatives in Bosnia and Herzegovina attach themselves to this framework. Examples include news reports of RTRS, a public broadcasting service of Republika Srpska entity in BiH, and some other news outlets. Glas kine is an online media product published by Centar za promociju i razvoj inicijative pojas i put, Bosnian national broadcaster BHRT broadcasted the show called ,,That Beautiful Beijing''

Foreign Policy.evidence: Diplomatic missions of the United Kingdom and Canada organized an informal meeting to discuss a joint cross-regional statement on China, to call on Chinese authorities to abide by their human rights obligations, to allow immediate, meaningful and unrestricted access to Xinjiang for independent observers, including the High Commissioner, and to urgently implement CERD’s eight recommendations related to Xinjiang, including ending the arbitrary detention of Uyghurs and members of other Muslim minorities. The proposed statement outlined the continued deterioration of human rights records in Xin jiang, Hong Kong and Tibet. The two missions presented a statement to the Council and sought the support of Bosnia and Herzegovina through diplomatic channels. They suggested that Bosnia and Herzegovina, having previously joined the statement at the third UN Committee in 2020, and in accordance with established practice, follows the positions of EU countries in joining the said statement. Bosnia and Herzegovina eventually co-signed the statement, and the Chinese Embassy in Sarajevo protested this decision strongly and on multiple occasions, urging the Bosnian side to remain neutral and not to interfere in China’s internal matters. They called for the preservation and application of true multilateralism as the right direction to address today’s complex issues, and a way to effectively address traditional and non-traditional security challenges. Page 19 of the URL doc.
Foreign Policy.note: Dodik osporava potpis BiH na UN izjavi o odnosu Kine prema Ujgurima (slobodnaevropa.org) www.slobodnaevropa.org/a/bih-kina-ujguri-dodik-turkovic-un/31370112.html; In 2021, Bosnian foreign minister signed a Joint Statement on the Human Rights Situation in Xinjiang   which was later denounced by member of presidency Milorad Dodik who said that it was signed withoug permision of the presidency.

Academia.evidence: Huawei talent program has been established at the University of Mostar
Academia.note: Nota bene: Back in 2019, there were official Chinese Embassy announcements related to Huawei company's active participation in the construction of the 4G network in BiH, as well as the smart city and the safe city in BiH. China also participated in the 22nd Mostar Fair 2019 as a partner country, and has been doing so for the past ten years, thus establishing a large-scale local presence of Chinese companies, such as Huawei and ZTE. Leading BiH Telecom operators use Huawei’s 4G network technology, and it is very likely that this company will also apply for a 5G network infrastructural set-up in due course.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: Faculty of Arts at the University of East Sarajevo (RS entity) signed an agreement with Ministry of Education of the People's Republic of China to establish a Department for Chinese language and culture. The department employs two lecturers/two native speakers of the Chinese language, professors with whom the learning of the Chinese language is completed in terms of practice and exercises. Every year, the local Faculty members (staff) are trained (through Chinese scholarships) in China, but also in centers of Chinese education located in Budapest, Latvia, etc.
Academia.note: The rise of China studies in Banja Luka has stimulated local youth by bringing novel content to an area that otherwise has difficulties retaining young people precisely because it is small and uneventful. Ultimately however, the Banja Luka China studies experience has been a result of local pro-activity in utilizing the opportunity to cooperate with China, which is in some sense an exception (as most-often, Chinese presence is not associated with local ownership of the initiatives). Other potential smaller scale examples could be sought elsewhere – one is the launch of a Chinese cultural center in Trebinje, a small town in RS which has little exciting contents to offer to its youth.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: The indicator is not supported by evidences and/or examples.

Domestic Politics.evidence: The PRC has invested more than 3 billion US dollars in Bosnia and Herzegovina by 2023, according to data from the Agency for the Promotion of Foreign Investments in Bosnia and Herzegovina (FIPA), which refers to the "China Global Investment Tracker" research data. According to data from the Central Bank of Bosnia and Herzegovina, the Chinese investors invest more in the Republika Srpska entity than in the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina entity. Republika Srpska insists on signing an interstate agreement between BiH and China, in order to implement infrastructure projects. For now, this was not possible, because there was no consent of the Council of Ministers of Bosnia and Herzegovina. This did not stop RS entity from pursuing their own economic interests with China, independently of the BiH state level government. The Chinese bank Exim is ready to finance the largest infrastructure projects in the Republic of Srpska, including the construction of sections of the future highway Belgrade - Banja Luka. The Chinese state company for the construction of roads and railways, "Shandong", has been present in Serbia for a long time, and in 2018, it opened a subsidiary company "SDHS-CSI BH" in Banja Luka (Republika Srpska). They also signed a concession contract for the construction of the Banjaluka-Prijedor highway with the Government of the RS. In the end of 2023, it was announced that Chinese companies, which submitted bids for the construction of the Buk Bijela hydroelectric plant (Drina river), requested additional guarantees from the Government of Bosnia and Herzegovina (i.e. RS entity) to sign a contract for this project worth 250 million euros. It is a joint project of Elektroprivreda Srbije and Elektroprivreda Republika Srpska, the hydroelectric plant should be built by one of the three Chinese companies that submitted bids a few months ago - Dongfang Electric Corporation, Power China and Energy China.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: From the period of former Yugoslavia, two Chinese cities already had status of sister cities with cities in Bosnia - Ningbo and Prijedor and Tianjin and Sarajevo. In recent years, the city of Eastern Sarajevo established this level of relationship with city of Cangzhou in Hebei province, and Sarajevo established with Dalian.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: A meeting of the delegations of the Alliance of Independent Social Democrats (SNSD) and the Communist Party of China was held in East Sarajevo, where the strategic partnership of the two political parties was confirmed. The SNSD delegation was led by Staša Košarac, a member of the SNSD Presidency and Minister of Foreign Trade and Economic Relations in the Council of Ministers, and the delegation of the Communist Party of China was led by Qian Hongshan, Deputy Minister of the International Department of the Central Committee of this party.

Bosnia and Herzegovina, where power is divided into the state and several lower ones, does not have a database for the entire country. But data from local ministries, cities and municipalities show an increasing use of surveillance cameras in recent years.

According to the data of the BiH Indirect Tax Administration, the import of recording equipment from China has increased in the last five years. Government procurement data shows imports rising from $3.4 million in 2018 to $5.4 million in 2023.

Society.evidence: The Chinese Embassy in Sarajevo has in March 2020 donated equipment in the value od 30.000 KM (cc. 18.000 USD) for the Center for Support for families with children and persons with difficulties in development "Cilibri"; in May 2021 the Embassy donated desinfectants in the value od 15.000 KM to the Islamic Community in BiH; Childer’s Choir of the Chinese city of Wuxi donated 42.000 masks to BiH in June 2020. There are also several reports from previous years which support the claim, such as: food packages for people who use Red Cross’ kitchen from the Chinese Embassy in Sarajevo in 2016; Embassy donated 40.000 USD for people who were hit by floods in 2011 and 10.000 KM in 2012; Association of Chinese Entrepreneurs donated clothing and toys in 2005 for children from socially endangered families, where the value of the donation was around 320.000 KM.

Law Enforcement.evidence: In 2018, the Border Police of Bosnia and Herzegovina, with a donation from the PRC in the amount of 9.5 million KM, renewed a part of the specialist equipment for surveillance and border checks. This equipment is still in use.
